meanings.definition: The act of making something inactive or nonfunctional.
meanings.sent1: The deactivation of the alarm system prevented any noise.
meanings.sent2: The deactivation of the account was necessary for security reasons.
meanings.sent3: After the deactivation of the robot, it just stood there like a statue.
meanings.sent4: The deactivation of the old factory marked the end of an era.
meanings.sent5: The deactivation of the bomb was a tense and delicate process.

meanings.definition: The process of disabling a function or feature.
meanings.sent1: The deactivation of the camera's flash improved battery life.
meanings.sent2: The deactivation of the auto-correct feature led to some funny typos.
meanings.sent3: The deactivation of the elevator music left everyone in awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: The deactivation of the fire alarm caused confusion during the drill.
meanings.sent5: The deactivation of the security system left the building vulnerable.

meanings.definition: The state of being turned off or rendered inoperative.
meanings.sent1: The deactivation of the lights plunged the room into darkness.
meanings.sent2: The deactivation of the engine signaled the end of the journey.
meanings.sent3: The deactivation of the TV remote made changing channels a workout.
meanings.sent4: The deactivation of the Wi-Fi left everyone disconnected from the world.
meanings.sent5: The deactivation of the phone left him feeling isolated and alone.
